sen.e: Shochiku Kyoto Studio(Shochiku Kyoto Satsuei-jo) is a film production studio owned by a company Shochiku, which located in Kyoto City from Taisho to Showa Era.

sen.e: Since it was transferred to Uzumasa films such as "Hana no shogai" (the life of flowers) directed by Tatsuyasu OSONE, "Seidou no kirisuto"(the bronze Christ) directed by Minoru SHIBUYA, and "Seppuku" directed by Masaki KOBAYASHI had been produced, however the film industry went into its twilight years and it was finally closed down in 1965.
